item.title: Laura Jane add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "His soul sat up. It met me. Those kinds of souls always do - the best ones. The ones who rise up and say "I know who you are and I am ready. Not that I want to go, of course, but I will come." Those souls are always light because more of them have been put out. More of them have already found their way to other places." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Laura Jane add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Well, art is art, isn't it? Still, on the other hand, water is water! And east is east and west is west and if you take cranberries and stew them like applesauce they taste much more like prunes than rhubarb does. Now, uh... now you tell me what you know." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Laura Jane add a quote by Anatole France
item.description: "Until one has loved an animal, a part of one's soul remains unawakened." -- Anatole France

item.title: Laura Jane add a quote by Martin Luther
item.description: "My heart, which is so full to overflowing, has often been solaced and refreshed by music when sick and weary." -- Martin Luther

item.title: Laura Jane add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Some of you say, “Joy is greater than sorrow,” and others say, “Nay, sorrow is the greater.” But I say unto you, they are inseparable. Together they come, and when one sits alone with you at your board, remember that the other is asleep upon your bed." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Laura Jane add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Laura Jane add a quote by Ira Gershwin
item.description: "The way you wear your hat, The way you sip your tea, The mem'ry of all that -- No, no! They can't take that away from me!" -- Ira Gershwin
